  Behavioral data in the novel tank test during and after conspecific alarm substance (CAS) exposure using WAY-163909 in zebrafish

This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. 

Try executing this chunk by clicking the *Run* button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing *Ctrl+Shift+Enter*. 

Data is produced by members from Laboratório de Neurociências e Comportamento "Frederico Guilherme Graeff", affiliated to Universidade Federal do Sul e Sudeste do Pará and Universidade do Estado do Pará. The package will include primary data for a behavioral experiment on the effects of WAY-163909 on zebrafish fear-like behavior. In Experiment 1, behavior during exposure was tested; in Experiment 2, behavior after exposure was tested.

* Load needed libraries
```{r}
if(!require(ggplot2)){
    install.packages("ggplot2")
    library(ggplot2)
}
if(!require(coin)){
    install.packages("coin")
    library(coin)
}
if(!require(RCurl)){
    install.packages("RCurl")
    library(RCurl)
}

if(!require(plyr)){
    install.packages("plyr")
    library(plyr)
}

if(!require(rcompanion)){
    install.packages("rcompanion")
    library(rcompanion)
}

if(!require(WRS2)){
    install.packages("WRS2")
    library(WRS2)
}

if(!require(psych)){
    install.packages("psych")
    library(psych)
}

if(!require(stats)){
    install.packages("stats")
    library(stats)
}

if(!require(sjtats)){
    library(devtools)
    devtools::install_github("strengejacke/sjstats")
    library(sjtats)
}

if(!require(multcompView)){
    install.packages("multcompView")
    library(multcompView)
}

if(!require(ggpubr)){
    install.packages("ggpubr")
    library(ggpubr)
}
```

* Load data

```{r}
x1 <- getURL("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lanec-unifesspa/5-HT-CAS/master/data/5HT2C/WAY161503/way_during.csv")
way_during <- read.csv(text = x1)
way_during$Treatment <- factor(way_during$Treatment, levels = c("CTRL", "CAS"))
way_during$Dose <- as.factor(way_during$Dose)
View(way_during)

x2 <- getURL("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lanec-unifesspa/5-HT-CAS/master/data/5HT2C/WAY161503/way_after.csv")
way_after <- read.csv(text = x2)
way_after$Treatment <- factor(way_after$Treatment, levels = c("CTRL", "CAS"))
way_after$Dose <- as.factor(way_after$Dose)
View(way_after)
```

* Detect outliers (based on time on bottom during exposure) and remove them, using a 3.5xMAD rule
```{r}
gA <- RS_during[c(1:10), ]
median(gA$TimeBottom) + 3.5*mad(gA$TimeBottom)
median(gA$TimeBottom) - 3.5*mad(gA$TimeBottom)
#Subjects A2 and A16 identified as outlier; remove

gB <- RS_during[c(11:30), ]
median(gB$TimeBottom) + 3.5*mad(gB$TimeBottom)
median(gB$TimeBottom) - 3.5*mad(gB$TimeBottom)

gC <- RS_during[c(31:51), ]
median(gC$TimeBottom) + 3.5*mad(gC$TimeBottom)
median(gC$TimeBottom) - 3.5*mad(gC$TimeBottom)


gD <- RS_during[c(52:72), ]
median(gD$TimeBottom) + 3.5*mad(gD$TimeBottom)
median(gD$TimeBottom) - 3.5*mad(gD$TimeBottom)
#No outliers
```

* Run ANOVA for main and interaction effects on 2-way ANOVA, for Experiment 1

1) Time on top
1.1) Analysis
```{r}
anova.tt.during <- aov(Time.Top ~ Treatment + Dose + Treatment:Dose, data = way_during) #run type I ANOVA
summary(anova.tt.during) #summarize ANOVA results
omega_sq(anova.tt.during) #Calculate effect size (omega-squared)
cohens_f(anova.tt.during) #Calculate effect size (Cohen's f-squared)
PTTT_during <- TukeyHSD(anova.tt.during) #run Tukey's HSD post hoc test
multcompLetters(PTTT_during$`Treatment:Dose`[,'p adj']) #Visualize results from post-test as letters
```

1.2) Graphics
```{r}
TTInt <- ddply(way_during, .(Dose, Treatment), summarise, val = mean(Time.Top))
TTplotDur <- ggplot(way_during, aes(x = factor(Dose), y = Time.Top, colour = Treatment)) + geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA) + geom_point(data = TTInt, aes(y = val, group = Treatment), position = position_dodge(width = 0.75)) + ylim(0, 360) + geom_line(data = TTInt, aes(y = val, group = Treatment), position = position_dodge(width = 0.75)) + geom_jitter(position = "dodge", alpha = 0.3) + geom_hline(yintercept = 120, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray") + labs(x = "Dose", y = "Time on top (s)", color = "Treatment") + scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Set1") + theme_bw() + annotate(geom = "text", x = 0.8, y = 60, label = "b")  +  annotate(geom = "text", x = 1.2, y = 30, label = "ab")  + annotate(geom = "text", x = 1.8, y = 60, label = "ab")  + annotate(geom = "text", x = 2.2, y = 30, label = "a") 
```

6) Join plots
```{r}
ggarrange(TTplotDur, TBplotDur, ESplotDur, FrplotDur, SpplotDur, labels = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), common.legend = TRUE, legend = "bottom")
```
